meanings.definition: To charge with a fault or offense
meanings.sent1: She will accuse her brother of breaking the vase.
meanings.sent2: The teacher may accuse a student of cheating if they see evidence.
meanings.sent3: During the game, the playful puppy will accuse the cat of stealing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seem to accuse the sky of hiding the sun.
meanings.sent5: The detective's accusing gaze made the suspect nervous.

meanings.definition: To blame or find fault with
meanings.sent1: He will accuse his friend of forgetting their plans.
meanings.sent2: It is not fair to accuse someone without evidence.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy old man will accuse the noisy birds of disturbing his peace.
meanings.sent4: The mirror seemed to accuse her tired reflection of aging too quickly.
meanings.sent5: The disappointed coach's accusing tone made the players feel guilty.
